newsitem.title: UK: EUROTUNNEL JULY TOURIST TRAFFIC UP 29.5 PCT.
newsitem.headline: EUROTUNNEL JULY TOURIST TRAFFIC UP 29.5 PCT.

text.p: Anglo-French Channel Tunnel operator Eurotunnel said on Thursday the number of vehicles using its Le Shuttle Tourist service in July rose 29.5 percent to 234,073 versus June.
"Le Shuttle Tourist traffic is therefore almost back to its July 1996 level, proving that the service is back to full strength," the company said in a statement.
Eurotunnel reported "very encouraging" results from Le Shuttle Freight in its first full month of operation since it resumed services in June after a fire last year.
The service carried 36,491 trucks in July compared with 53,978 in the year-ago month.
Eurostar traffic beat all previous records in July with 651,849 passengers, up 24 percent on June and 23 percent on July 1996.

Tonnage carried by rail freight trains in July slipped three percent to 266,345 tonnes due to seasonal variations versus June, but that number was still 24 percent higher than July 1996, the company said.
